Australia did not enact a total gun ban: it banned certain guns, including semi-automatics after a mass shooting in 1996.
Venezuela: s government took steps to stem the flow of guns in 2012 and 2013, but it was not a similar approach to Australia's gun control measures.
Millions of guns remain in civilian hand: but gun deaths are a major problem in Venezuela.
Australia implemented a buyback program: resulting in the collection of over 640,000 weapons, while Venezuela did not have a similar program.
